page.title: 18FAIRFORD PEACE GROUP
page.content: In May l984, a number of people who were worried about the threat of a nuclear world catastrophe formed a town{peace group.} Its members sought to arouse public concern by means of lectures, films, demonstrations and vigils. A peace picnic alternative to the International Air Tattoo was organised. National CND activities were supported. There was also protest against increased militarism in the town caused by the developing presence of the USAF with its noisy strato-tankers, alarms in the night, bugle call reveilles, etc. All this was seen as an unnecessary violation of the peace of a pleasant Cotswold town. Was the country really being threatened? What was to be the ending of it all? By September l985 the group had a membership of about 5O from varied walks of life.
